image.altText: A crane on a beach on a cloudy day lugging sand around and sorting erosion.

props.synopsis: Parts of the New South Wales Central and South coasts are being lashed by a vigorous coastal low weather system that is causing damaging winds and heavy rainfall. Follow live.

title.children: 35,000 without power, flights cancelled as parts of NSW lashed by wild weather

image.altText: An illustration of line graphics surrounding a mobile phone tower.

props.synopsis: Spectrum worth billions of dollars is likely to be rolled over to existing holders rather than auctioned, potentially costing taxpayers billions and the chance of increased competition in telecommunications, critics say.

title.children: $3.2 billion taxpayer 'gift' for telcos including Telstra, Optus

image.altText: Peter Dutton in Hobart, tasting wine at winery. Seat of Lyons

props.synopsis: Assuming Liberal leader Sussan Ley takes a COMCAR to Parliament House, the rest of the Liberal women can get there in a Corolla.

title.children: No matter how low the number, the Liberal Party script on women in the party is the same

image.altText: Jason Clare seen between two people.

props.synopsis: The education minister has promised new powers to strip childcare centres of funding if they do not meet safety standards. Follow live.

title.children: Government plans to strip funding from childcare centres that fail safety standards

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Wong says US and Australia 'both understand' importance of AUKUS
Govt wants power to cut funding to childcare centres not meeting safety standards
Australia's defence spending not discussed in Wong's meeting with Rubio

image.altText: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and US President Donald Trump shake hands.

props.synopsis: With the Israeli military signalling it has achieved its aims in Gaza and the public increasingly wary of ongoing war, Benjamin Netanyahu may soon need to make a ceasefire deal.

title.children: The 'one person' who wants the Gaza war to continue may be forced to make a deal

props.synopsis: As the world waits to see if Donald Trump's talks will go ahead, look back at how previous US presidents have handled Iran.

title.children: The US helped start Iran's nuclear program — but now wants to end it

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with toys.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government is changing its Working with Children Check laws after ABC reporting revealed they are the weakest in the country.

title.children: Victoria to strengthen Working with Children Check system, years after change recommended

image.altText: A street with cars and buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: Morwell has played host to Erin Patterson's murder trial for the past nine weeks. Here's what it's been like in the regional Victorian town.

title.children: When the world is watching one town and its courtroom, what happens?

image.altText: Commissioner Travis Lovett at the Walk for Truth.

props.synopsis: After more than four years and over 1,300 submissions, Australia's first Indigenous-led truth-telling inquiry has handed down its final report, calling for major reform.

title.children: 'This was a genocide': Key takeaways from Australia's first Indigenous-led truth-telling inquiry

image.altText: Donald Trump holds his hands out while speaking, wearing a red MAGA cap and a suit.

props.synopsis: The US Senate has passed President Donald Trump's so-called "big beautiful bill" despite opposition from several Republican politicians and billionaire Elon Musk.

title.children: US Senate passes Trump's 'big beautiful bill' by narrow margin

image.altText: A close up photo of Donald Trump. He his tilting his head and looking ahead with a slight frown.

props.synopsis: Australian stocks are set for modest gains, even as US tech stocks drag America's benchmark index off its record high. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set to defy Wall St dip as Trump's tax bill clears Senate

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: US Senate passes Trump's Big, Beautiful Bill by one vote after all night session
Central bank get together in Portugal
US stocks falter on big tech, budget and tariff risks

image.altText: Sean Combs wears a black jacket and white tie.

props.synopsis: The jury at Sean "Diddy" Combs's sex trafficking trial reaches verdicts on four of the five counts the music mogul faces, but cannot agree on the most serious charge of racketeering conspiracy.

title.children: Diddy jury reaches partial verdict but deadlocked on racketeering charge

image.altText: Zohran Mamdani

props.synopsis: "There's a real assembly line for incoming politicians that has changed the nature of the kinds of people that get elected," a political academic tells the ABC.

title.children: Mamdani broke through American's political establishment. That's harder to do in Australia

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie poses with a Russian passport in front of a Russian crest.

props.synopsis: A Russian-backed organisation that has bankrolled the legal defence of alleged spies and criminals has been sanctioned by the federal government just weeks after an investigation detailed its support for Australia's most prominent pro-Putin propagandist.

title.children: Russia-backed fund that bankrolled 'Aussie Cossack' sanctioned by Australia

image.altText: Laptop on desk with chatGPT displayed on screen

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is changing the workforce. Industry experts look at the careers most likely to be impacted and what the research reveals about graduate jobs and women.

title.children: AI's gendered glitch — how careers are being reshaped

image.altText: For Rent sign outside a property.

props.synopsis: Thousands fewer investors declared rental income in 2022-23 than a year earlier — only the third time annual falls have occurred, according to Australian Tax Office data.

title.children: Rental investor numbers fall for third time since records began, ATO data shows

image.altText: A traditional-looking housewife smiles at the camera as she holds a pie standing in a pink-coloured pantry

props.synopsis: What is it about the tradwife movement and its strict traditional gender roles that has struck a chord with modern day mothers?

title.children: These modern stay-at-home mums are redefining what it means to be a tradwife

image.altText: Dishwasher stacked with dishes after being rinsed first

props.synopsis: New research has found cleaning plastic containers in the dishwasher is actually a source of microplastic pollution.

title.children: Average dishwasher releases 33 million microplastic particles per year, research finds

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Cheshire Police says the investigation into corporate manslaughter offences does not have any impact on Lucy Letby's 2023 convictions for murder and attempted murder.

title.children: Police arrest hospital bosses where killer nurse Lucy Letby worked

image.altText: A false-colour map showing a wind forecast, with strong winds directed towards the NSW coast.

props.synopsis: The effect of the NSW "bomb cyclone" is being felt in parts of the Sunshine State.

title.children: Fallout of 'bomb cyclone' sees flights cancelled, destructive winds hit Qld

image.altText: Roslyn Sullivan speaks to journalists.

props.synopsis: In handing down his early assessment of Cleveland Dodd's death, the coroner could have given a vote of confidence in the Department of Justice's response to the tragedy. He didn't. WARNING: This story discusses incidents of self-harm and contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: Coroner's early take on youth detention death sends vote of no confidence

image.altText: Daria Kasatkina looks down wearing a white shirt

props.synopsis: Daria Kasatkina overcomes a huge bout of nerves before her Wimbledon debut representing Australia, as Alex de Minaur, Aleksandar Vukic and Rinky Hijikata help lead an Aussie revival on day two.

title.children: Nervous Kasatkina vomits courtside before leading Aussie Wimbledon revival

image.altText: A dingo eats from a jar of peanut butter while lying in some long grass.

props.synopsis: Rangers on the World Heritage-listed island off Queensland's coast urge visitors to secure their food, bait and rubbish from dingoes.

title.children: Belongings destroyed as K'gari rangers warn of four-legged thieves

image.altText: A woman walking past a house on fire at night.

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin also speaks with his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron for the first time since 2022.

title.children: Russia denies US claims it is trying to 'stall' Ukraine peace negotiations

image.altText: india factor explosion 1

props.synopsis: At least 36 people have been killed and about three dozen injured in a massive explosion and fire at a pharmaceutical factory in India.

title.children: Indian factory explosion kills at least 36 people

image.altText: man in suit smiling next to man in sports jacket with grey hair in golf buggy

props.synopsis: Critics have accused South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas of "shafting" Adelaide City Council after the government legislated to take over the city's urban golf course

title.children: 'Keeps the plebs happy': SA premier at centre of golf controversy

image.altText: Coco Gauff reacts to losing a point with left hand up

props.synopsis: Coco Gauff becomes just the third woman in the Open era to lose in the first round at Wimbledon immediately after claiming the French Open title.

title.children: Gauff and Zverev headline stunning list of first-round Wimbledon exits

image.altText: On stage, David Campbell, a 51-year-old man in a suit, smiles as he sings, clicking his fingers, a band behind him.

props.synopsis: David Campbell, Virginia Gay, Natalie Abbott and Victoria Falconer are stars of Australian cabaret. They share what they love about the art form and how they got started.

title.children: Larrikinism draped in feathers and sequins: That's Australian cabaret

image.altText: Man looking away from camera wears green beanie with 'Devils' written on it

props.synopsis: Whether or not to spend many millions of dollars on a stadium in Hobart is a question being weighed by voters, with some saying they'll change who they usually vote for.

title.children: Some Tasmanians are changing the party they'll support 'for the first time ever'

image.altText: A dry paddock through a wire fence.

props.synopsis: Parts of south-west and western Victoria have been experiencing their lowest rainfall since 1900 and climatologists say recent downpours won't be enough to end the drought.

title.children: What will it take to break the drought in Victoria?

image.altText: an aerial view of a blue bay and mangroves

props.synopsis: More than two-thirds of Western Australia's threatened ecological communities are ineffectively monitored and protected.

title.children: Investigation finds government failing to protect vulnerable WA environment

image.altText: A great white shark swimming towards a GoPro camera next to a cage full of tourists.

props.synopsis: Most Australians think all shark attacks make the news, but the majority of run-ins with the apex predators are not reported and don't end up in the official statistics.

title.children: Fatal shark attacks make news, but many 'close encounters' unreported
